Generate random time series dataframe

{% raw %}

generate_TS_df[source]

generate_TS_df(rows, cols)

Generates a dataframe containing a multivariate time series, where each column represents a variable and each row a time point (sample). The timestamp is in the index of the dataframe, and it is created with a even space of 1 second between samples

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
df = generate_TS_df(3, 5)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
test_eq(df.shape, (3, 5))
{% endraw %}

pandas Dataframe utilities

Normalize columns

{% raw %}

normalize_columns[source]

normalize_columns(df:DataFrame)

Normalize columns from df to have 0 mean and 1 standard deviation

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
foo = generate_TS_df(3, 3)
foo.describe()
0 1 2
count 3.000000 3.000000 3.000000
mean -0.202306 -0.459356 0.304291
std 0.445546 0.448938 0.320722
min -0.616619 -0.944742 0.110391
25% -0.437954 -0.659514 0.119192
50% -0.259288 -0.374287 0.127993
75% 0.004851 -0.216663 0.401241
max 0.268990 -0.059039 0.674489
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
bar = normalize_columns(foo)
bar.describe()
0 1 2
count 3.000000e+00 3.000000e+00 3.000000e+00
mean -1.850372e-17 1.110223e-16 -1.850372e-16
std 9.999998e-01 9.999998e-01 9.999997e-01
min -9.299002e-01 -1.081188e+00 -6.045728e-01
25% -5.288969e-01 -4.458489e-01 -5.771327e-01
50% -1.278937e-01 1.894903e-01 -5.496926e-01
75% 4.649501e-01 5.405940e-01 3.022864e-01
max 1.057794e+00 8.916978e-01 1.154265e+00
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
test_close(bar.describe().loc['mean'].values, np.repeat(0.0, len(bar.columns)))
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
test_close(bar.describe().loc['std'].values, np.repeat(1.0, len(bar.columns)))
{% endraw %}

Remove constant columns

{% raw %}

remove_constant_columns[source]

remove_constant_columns(df:DataFrame)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
foo = generate_TS_df(3, 3)
foo['constant'] = [0.0]*len(foo)
foo
0 1 2 constant
2021-01-25 10:56:47.066244 -0.578937 1.838584 0.720022 0.0
2021-01-25 10:56:48.066244 2.658628 0.063197 0.922973 0.0
2021-01-25 10:56:49.066244 0.114976 -1.445801 0.350152 0.0
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
bar = remove_constant_columns(foo)
bar
0 1 2
2021-01-25 10:56:47.066244 -0.578937 1.838584 0.720022
2021-01-25 10:56:48.066244 2.658628 0.063197 0.922973
2021-01-25 10:56:49.066244 0.114976 -1.445801 0.350152
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
column_diff = set(foo.columns) - set(bar.columns)
test_eq_type(column_diff, set(['constant']))
{% endraw %}

Create wandb artifact containing just the reference to an object pass as argument

{% raw %}

class ReferenceArtifact[source]

ReferenceArtifact(obj, name, folder=None, description=None, metadata=None) :: Artifact

An artifact object you can write files into, and pass to log_artifact.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

When a reference artifact is used by one wandb run, we should have a method to get the original object from it

{% raw %}

Artifact.to_obj[source]

Artifact.to_obj()

Download the files of a saved ReferenceArtifact and get the referenced object. The artifact must come from a call to run.use_artifact with a proper wandb run.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Test with Reference artifact from a df

{% raw %} 
foo = generate_TS_df(3, 3)
bar = ReferenceArtifact(obj=foo, name='test_reference_artifact', folder='/')
bar.manifest.entries.values()

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
PermissionError                           Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-18-90bf059d8487> in <module>
      1 foo = generate_TS_df(3, 3)
----> 2 bar = ReferenceArtifact(obj=foo, name='test_reference_artifact', folder='/')
      3 bar.manifest.entries.values()

<ipython-input-16-96d1ad711cf7> in __init__(self, obj, name, folder, **kwargs)
     11         hash_code = str(hash(pickle.dumps(obj)))
     12         folder = Path(ifnone(folder, Path.home()/self.default_storage_path))
---> 13         with open(f'{folder}/{hash_code}', 'wb') as f:
     14             pickle.dump(obj, f)
     15         self.add_reference(f'file://{folder}/{hash_code}')

PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '//2111032565604952391'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
test_eq(bar.name, 'test_reference_artifact')
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
test_eq(bar.metadata['ref']['type'], str(type(foo)))
{% endraw %}

foo = np.random.randn(5)
bar = ReferenceArtifact(obj=foo, name='test_reference_artifact', folder='/')
bar.manifest.entries.values()

dict_values([<ManifestEntry ref: file:////-7284171405855839870/-7284171405855839870>])
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
test_eq(bar.metadata['ref']['type'], str(type(foo)))

Keras add plot_top_losses functionality

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

Sequential.plot_top_losses[source]

Sequential.plot_top_losses(validation_data, k, largest=True, return_fig=True, title_pos=0.99, **kwargs)

Take the validation data of model self, compute the model losses for every item there, sort, and plot the results. If largest is True, the validation losses will be sorted from larger to lower. Once they are sorted, take the k first items based on this order and plot the predictions. If 'return_fig' is true, a Figure-set of plots is returned. If not, just showed on screen

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}
